title: Inclusive Meetings Toolkit
text:
Preface
This is created using Quarto! To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.
It’s important to have inclusive meetings, because everyone should be able to participate and inclusive meetings are effective meetings.
In this toolkit there are resources you can use for meeting planning, facilitation and follow up.
Ideas and feedback welcome in the github repository.

title: 1  Introduction
text: This is an inclusive meeting toolkit for virtual meetings.

title: 2  Summary
text:
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: References
text: Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Checklist
text:
This is a checklist you can review when planning a virtual meeting.

Calendar invitation with meeting link and link to agenda
Agenda
Facilitator identified
Facilitation approach identified

title: Inclusive Meetings Toolkit
text:
Inclusive Meeting Toolkit
This is created using Quarto! To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.
It’s important to have inclusive meetings, because everyone should be able to participate and inclusive meetings are effective meetings.
In this toolkit there are resources you can use for meeting planning, facilitation and follow up.
Ideas and feedback welcome in the github repository.

title: 3  Cheatsheet
text: The is a cheatsheet with the key points around inclusive meetings

title: 4  Planning the Meeting
text: An important part of any meeting is planning it in advance. What type of meeting is it, what are the goals?

title: 5  Opening the Meeting
text: How you start off the meeting matters, it sets the tone.

title: 6  Meeting Facilitation
text: There are a few key components to facilitation of a meeting.

title: 7  Responding
text: Sometimes things don’t go the way you hope. How can you get things back on track?

title: 8  Closing
text: How you close the meeting also matters, people remember the end, and also it’s a chance to recap any action items.

title: 9  Follow Up
text: Not all meetings require follow up after the meeting, but some do. You’ll want to note action items wherever your team notes these things, and potentially send out a summary.
